author: potuz
content:
~~Hello, I tend to avoid API discussions, but this one actually bothers me. The `dependent_root` in the spec is defined as `get_block_root_at_slot(state, compute_start_slot_at_epoch(epoch) - 1)` for the current epoch and similarly for the previous epoch.  Nodes typically have very much handy the target root which would be `get_block_root_at_slot(state, compute_start_slot_at_epoch(epoch))`. Now this root already commits to the previous one therefore it gives actually more information and it is faster to acccess than the one the spec specifies. 
- Question 1: would any REST VC be broken if we return these roots instead of the `-1` ones?
- Question 2: Can we please change these API endpoints to point to these roots instead?~~

author: potuz
content: ~~I understand that there is a simple edge case in which the slot 31 is the fork slot and then two different forks happen with one at 32 and the other one at 33. These would have different dependent roots with my scheme while the same one in the previous one. In this scenario with my scheme we would request again duties while they would be the same~~

author: potuz
content: ~~but this little edge case does not justify getting a root that we do not have cached.~~

author: potuz
content: Nevermind, anyway it's not so hard to overload the cache to keep these roots... still bugs me to do it, but changing the API is more painful
